All Implemented Interfaces:
Dataset, FeatureClass, GeoDataset, MapDataset, Searchable, Selectable, Table
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseMemoryFeatureClass
public class MemoryFeatureClass
extends MemorySearchable

This class provides the ability to build a custom dataset consisting of Features that are derived from some other process, rather than obtaining it directly from a data source.

You can add and delete features to/from a MemoryFeatureClass using the addFeature and removeFeature methods. All features added, are stored in a spatial index kept in memory.

Note: Do not store too many features this way, as you will quickly run out of memory.

To view the changes after you add/remove features, you must redraw the map.

Constructor Detail

MemoryFeatureClass

public MemoryFeatureClass(int ft,
                          Fields fields)
Constructs a new MemoryFeatureClass object with the given feature type and Fields collection.

Note: A MemoryFeatureClass object can only have one type of Feature.

Parameters:
ft - the feature type (allowed types are defined by setFeatureType)
fields - the Field collection
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if either ft or fields is null
See Also:
BaseFeatureClass.setFeatureType(int)
Method Detail

setName

public void setName(String name)
Sets the name of the MemoryFeatureClass with given string. This method should be called before adding it to a FeatureLayer, because the default behaviour of a Layer is to use the name of the associated FeatureClass.

Overrides:
setName in class BaseDataset
Parameters:
name - the Dataset name
See Also:
FeatureLayer.setFeatureClass(com.esri.mo2.data.feat.FeatureClass)
